definition.title: Why YouTube Descriptions Matter
definition.content: YouTube descriptions help the algorithm understand your content and help viewers decide to watch. The first 2-3 sentences appear in search results, timestamps enable chapters, and proper structure drives engagement.

tips: Front-load keywords - the first 2-3 sentences appear in search results; make them count
Use timestamps for chapters - format as 0:00 - Introduction to enable YouTube's chapter feature
Include one primary CTA - subscribe, comment, or check links; pick your priority
Add relevant links - resources mentioned, social profiles, and related videos

faq.question: How long should my description be?
faq.answer: Aim for 200-300 words minimum. YouTube's algorithm uses description text for ranking. More context helps discoverability.

faq.question: Should I use timestamps?
faq.answer: Yes! Timestamps improve watch time metrics and create clickable chapters. Format as 0:00 - Chapter Name.

faq.question: Where should I put keywords?
faq.answer: Front-load keywords in the first 2-3 sentences. These appear in search results before the 'Show more' cut-off.

faq.question: What CTAs work best?
faq.answer: Ask for specific actions: subscribe, comment with answers, check links. One primary CTA per video works best.
